intro: Oxymeris dolichantha, commonly known as the long-fruited oxymeris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces elongated, cylindrical fruits. Oxymeris dolichantha is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
